item.title: Ubuntu 22.04.3 Failed to open NVENC codec

item.content:encoded:
Hello, I'm trying to Start Recording.
OBS 30.0.1 (64 bit) plays the camcorder, but when I select Start Recording, the prompt shows:
Failed to start recording. Failed to open NVENC codec: Generic error in an external library. Try installing the latest NVIDIA driver and closing other recording software that might be using NVENC such as NVIDIA ShadowPlay or Windows Game DVR.

My Desktop Ubuntu 22.04.3 has NVIDIA X Server and GeForce NOW installed.

item.author: invalid@example.com (Linuxfarmer)
item.dc:creator: Linuxfarmer
item.content:encoded:
Hello,
trying to capture a Steam Proton game with OBS and vkcapture, so first hands first the versions.

System: Linuxmint 21.2
Steam - Native Install
OBS 30.0.2 from Flatpak

To make things easy, i tried with Cyberpunk, start command from Steam is "OBS_VKCAPTURE=1 WINEDLLOVERRIDES="winmm.dll,version=n,b" %command%"

After game launch i started OBS from a terminal with "OBS_USE_EGL=1 flatpak run com.obsproject.Studio"

Added the audio succesful in OBS, found "gamecapture" in the sources...

item.title: Bug: "Resize output (source size)" does not respect cropping done by alt+dragging edges of a source and resizing.
item.author: invalid@example.com (laund)
item.dc:creator: laund
item.content:encoded:
Before "Resize output (source size)", the source is cropped by holding Alt and dragging the edges, and resized by dragging the edges without Alt

After "Resize output (source size)" is pressed, it scales the cropped region up to the original source size, and keeps the same aspect ratio:


This seems to happen with multiple sources. I tested Window Capture (Xcomposite) and Screen Capture (XSHM)


This issue makes easily capturing small regions of the screen, for...

Read more

item.content:encoded:
Trying to setup streaming for YouTube in OBS Studio 30.0 that I installed on Ubuntu 23.04 via SNAP. I have my streaming key from YouTube. In OBS 'Settings' section I have selected YouTube RTMPS as the Service, Primary YouTube Ingest Server as the Server, entered the Stream Key, hit Apply then OK. item.title: ntv2 is now libajantv2
item.author: invalid@example.com (jiapei100)
item.dc:creator: jiapei100
item.content:encoded:
As clearly announced in [https://github.com/aja-video/ntv2](https://github.com/aja-video/ntv2) :

```

This repository is deprecated as of 12/11/2023. Please use https://github.com/aja-video/libajantv2​

```

I'm expecting OBS to support the new **libajantv2**. The current error message:

```
CMake Error in UI/frontend-plugins/aja-output-ui/CMakeLists.txt:
Imported target "AJA::LibAJANTV2" includes non-existent path...

item.title: Output to Nextcloud Talk? | Am I asking OBS to do something it can't?
item.author: invalid@example.com (BasmentBroadcastingCorp)
item.dc:creator: BasmentBroadcastingCorp
item.content:encoded:
Hi
I admit I am being lazy and not RTFMing much and so deserve all your disdain.

I teach single students on Nextcloud using their app "Talk". My setup is very simple and low-tech: a whiteboard on a table with a camera above. The cameras and microphones are select-able via a drop-down in Talk. I just select the camera and the microphone and start the meeting. This part of Talk feels lot like jitsi meet, if that helps.

It would be nice to be able to switch sources quickly and reliably and...

Read more

item.title: Video Capture Device (v4l2) plugin
item.author: invalid@example.com (leonhard)
item.dc:creator: leonhard
item.content:encoded:
Since information about this plugin is spread all over the place (forum threads / mantis bugtracker) this thread aims to gather all information relevant to the v4l2 capture plugin.

Known Issues
  • The framesize/framerate options are currently hardcoded for some devices.
  • There seem to be problems with devices that need the v4l2compat library.
  • Interleaved formats are handled incorrectly
  • Colorspace/Range is currently handled incorrectly (not at all)

"My device does...

Read more

item.title: Recording ends prematurely: "An encoder error occurred while recording" (Ubuntu 22.04)
item.author: invalid@example.com (nickanderson)
item.dc:creator: nickanderson
item.content:encoded:
I can't seem to record for more than 5 or 6 minutes without getting an error. I've tried various encoder settings and frame rates without success.

Most commonly I see one of these:

[ffmpeg muxer: 'adv_file_output'] os_process_pipe_write for info structure failed [ffmpeg muxer: 'adv_file_output'] os_process_pipe_write for packet data failed [ffmpeg muxer: 'simple_file_output'] os_process_pipe_write for packet data failed

Have you any advice?

item.title: AMD HW Encoder not present in Flatpack OBS
item.author: invalid@example.com (Glitch Artist)
item.dc:creator: Glitch Artist
item.content:encoded:
Are there any flatpack plugins out there that will let me use my RX7800XT as the hardware encoding device? Software encoding kinda blows, and I can't use the PPA version since it crashes with a segfault (problem listed here https://obsproject.com/forum/threads/segmentation-fault.171763/).
I would rather try to stay away from obsvkcature since I've had issues with it not working in the past, and I'm not certain it'll work anyway since my steam installation is not flatpack.

item.title: Audio lost?
item.author: invalid@example.com (Disappointedcreeper)

item.content:encoded: I was recording for over an hour, and for some reason there is no audio track. I had the desktop audio and mic audio both turned on, and doing tests it was not caused by the game I was playing, or the fact it was fullscreened. Is there any way to recover the lost audio, like from a backup or something?
